Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and reddish in section, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a pale-red slip and remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394492) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394492)
